“Yes.”

original: Nanu bhagavā saccavādī kālavādī bhūtavādī tathavādī avitathavādī anaññathavādīti?
analyzed: nanu bhagavā sacca vādī kāla vādī bhūta vādī tatha vādī avitatha vādī anaññatha vādī iti
translated: Doesn’t the Buddha speak the truth, speak what’s real, speak what’s factual, speak what’s relevant, speak Dhamma, speak Vinaya?
Yes.
The Buddha has said that
all things are not-self.
Is there such a discourse?
Yes.
Well then, you shouldn’t say that
an individual can be discerned in an ultimate sense.
Can an individual be discerned in an ultimate sense?
Yes.

original: Nanu bhagavā saccavādī kālavādī bhūtavādī tathavādī avitathavādī anaññathavādīti?
analyzed: nanu bhagavā sacca vādī kāla vādī bhūta vādī tatha vādī avitatha vādī anaññatha vādī iti
translated: Doesn’t the Buddha speak the truth, speak what’s real, speak what’s factual, speak what’s relevant, speak Dhamma, speak Vinaya?
Yes.
The Buddha has said that

original: “dukkhameva uppajjamānaṁ uppajjati, dukkhameva nirujjhamānaṁ nirujjhatīti na kaṅkhati na vicikicchati, aparappaccayaññāṇamevassa ettha hoti.
analyzed: dukkham eva uppajjamānam uppajjati dukkham eva nirujjhamānam nirujjhati iti na kaṅkhati na vicikicchati apara paccaya ññāṇam eva assa ettha hoti
translated: when suffering arises, it arises only in dependence on a condition, and when suffering ceases, it ceases only in dependence on a condition. He doesn’t doubt or hesitate that this is so. He has the knowledge that he doesn’t depend on anything else.

analyzed: ettāvatā kho kaccāna sammādiṭṭhi hoti iti
translated: To this extent, Kaccana, there is right view.
Is there such a discourse?
Yes.
Well then, you shouldn’t say that
an individual can be discerned in an ultimate sense.
Is a person found in a real and ultimate sense?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu vajirā bhikkhunī māraṁ pāpimantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: nanu vajirā bhikkhunī māram pāpimantam etat avoca
translated: “Didn’t the nun Vajirā say this to the Wicked One:
‘You think there’s a being, Wicked One,

analyzed: māra diṭṭhi gatam nu te  suddha saṅkhāra puñjoya
translated: but you’re just a view-holder.🔽This is just a heap of conditions;
there’s no being to be found here.
Just as when the parts are assembled,
the word ‘chariot’ is used,
so when the components are present,
the convention ‘a being’ is used.

original: Dukkhameva hi sambhoti,🔽dukkhaṁ tiṭṭhati veti ca;
analyzed: dukkham eva hi sambhoti  dukkham tiṭṭhati veti ca
translated: Only suffering comes to be,🔽only suffering passes away.
Apart from suffering, nothing comes to be;
apart from suffering, nothing passes away.’
“Is there such a suttanta?”
“Yes.”

original: Tena hi na vattabbaṁ—🔽“puggalo upalabbhati saccikaṭṭhaparamatthenā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi na vattabba  puggalaḥ upalabbhati saccikaṭṭha paramatthena ati
translated: “Well then, you shouldn’t say🔽that a person is found in a real and ultimate sense.”
“Is a person found in a real and ultimate sense?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: nanu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: “Didn’t Venerable Ānanda say this to the Buddha:

analyzed: suññaḥ loko suññaḥ loko ti bhante vuccati
translated: ‘Sir, it’s said, “The world is empty”.

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, ‘suñño loko’ti vuccatī”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante suññaḥ loko ti vuccati iti
translated: In what way is it said that the world is empty?’

original: “Yasmā kho, ānanda, suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā, tasmā ‘suñño loko’ti vuccati.
analyzed: yasmā kho ānanda suññam attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā suññaḥ loko ti vuccati
translated: “Because it is empty of self or of what belongs to self, Ānanda, that is why it is said, ‘The world is empty.’

original: Kiñcānanda, suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā?🔽Cakkhuṁ kho, ānanda, suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā, rūpā suññā …pe… cakkhuviññāṇaṁ🔽suññaṁ … cakkhusamphasso suñño … yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ
analyzed: kiñca ānanda suññam attena vā attaniyena vā  cakkhum kho ānanda suññam attena vā attaniyena vā rūpā suññā pe cakkhu viññāṇa  suññam cakkhu samphasso suññaḥ  yam pidam cakkhu samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayita
translated: “And what, Ānanda, is empty of self or of what belongs to self?

original: sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā, tampi suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā, sotaṁ suññaṁ …pe…🔽saddā suññā … ghānaṁ suññaṁ … gandhā suññā … jivhā suññā … rasā suññā … kāyo suñño🔽… phoṭṭhabbā suññā … mano suñño … dhammā suññā … manoviññāṇaṁ suññaṁ … manosamphasso
analyzed: sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi suññam attena vā attaniyena vā sotam suññam pe  saddā suññā ghānam suññam gandhā suññā jivhā suññā rasā suññā kāyaḥ suññaḥ  phoṭṭhabbā suññā manaḥ suññaḥ dhammā suññā manaḥ viññāṇam suññam manaḥ samphassaḥ
translated: The eye, Ānanda, is empty of self or of what belongs to self. Forms are empty … Eye-consciousness is empty … Eye-contact is empty … Whatever feeling arises with eye-contact as condition—whether pleasant or painful or neither-painful-nor-pleasant—that too is empty of self or of what belongs to self.

original: suñño … yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ🔽vā, tampi suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā.
analyzed: suññaḥ yat pidam manaḥ samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukha 🔽vā tampi suññam attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: The ear is empty … Sounds are empty … The nose is empty … Smells are empty … The tongue is empty … Tastes are empty … The body is empty … Tactile objects are empty … The mind is empty … Ideas are empty … Mind-consciousness is empty … Mind-contact is empty … Whatever feeling arises with mind-contact as condition—whether pleasant or painful or neither-painful-nor-pleasant—that too is empty of self or of what belongs to self.

original: Yasmā kho, ānanda, suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā, tasmā ‘suñño loko’ti vuccatī”ti.
analyzed: yasmā kho ānanda suññam attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā suññaḥ loko ti vuccati iti
translated: Because of being empty of self and what belongs to self, it is said to be empty.”
“Is there a sutta whose meaning you don’t understand?”
“Yes.”
“Well then, you shouldn’t say this:
‘A person is found who is a real person in the ultimate sense.’”
“Is a person found who is a real person in the ultimate sense?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu bhagavā saccavādī kālavādī bhūtavādī tathavādī avitathavādī anaññathavādīti?
analyzed: nanu bhagavā sacca vādī kāla vādī bhūta vādī tatha vādī avitatha vādī anaññatha vādī iti
translated: “But didn’t the Buddha say that he is the one who speaks what is real, what is factual, what is true, what is in accordance with the way things are, and what the ascetic Gotama doesn’t say is not so?”
“Yes.”
“The Buddha said:🔽‘If there is a self, there is what belongs to self.’

original: “attani vā, bhikkhave, sati ‘attaniyaṁ me’ti assā”ti?🔽“Evaṁ, bhante”.
analyzed: attani vā bhikkhave sati attaniyam mā iti assa ati  eva bhante
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: attaniye vā bhikkhave sati attā mā iti assa ati
translated: “If there is what belongs to self, there is a self.’
“Yes.”

original: “Attani ca, bhikkhave, attaniye ca saccato thetato anupalabbhiyamāne yampidaṁ diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṁ
analyzed: attani ca bhikkhave attaniye ca saccataḥ thetataḥ an upalabbhiyamāne yam pidam diṭṭhi ṭṭhāna
translated: “When a self and what belongs to self are not apprehended in this way,🔽then this standpoint for views—

original: so loko so attā so pecca bhavissāmi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, sassatisamaṁ tatheva ṭhassāmīti—
analyzed: saḥ loko saḥ attā saḥ pecca bhavissāmi niccaḥ dhuvaḥ sassataḥ a vipariṇāma dhammo sassati samam tathā iva ṭhassāmi iti
translated: ‘This world is the self. After death, I will be permanent, everlasting, eternal, not subject to change; I will stand firm like unto the eternal’—

analyzed: bhikkhave kevalo paripūraḥ bāla dhammo ti
translated: ‘Is this not a complete and pure fool’s doctrine?’

original: “Kiñhi no siyā, bhante, kevalo hi, bhante, paripūro bāladhammo”ti.
analyzed: kim hi no siyā bhante kevalaḥ hi bhante paripūraḥ bāla dhammaḥ ti
translated: ‘How could it not be, Lord? It is a complete and pure fool’s doctrine.’
Is there such a discourse?
Yes.

original: Tena hi na vattabbaṁ—🔽“puggalo upalabbhati saccikaṭṭhaparamatthenā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi na vattabba  puggalaḥ upalabbhati saccikaṭṭha paramatthena ati
translated: Then you shouldn’t say that.
Is there such a discourse?
Yes.

original: Nanu bhagavā saccavādī kālavādī bhūtavādī tathavādī avitathavādī anaññathavādīti?
analyzed: nanu bhagavā sacca vādī kāla vādī bhūta vādī tatha vādī avitatha vādī anaññatha vādī iti
translated: But didn’t the Buddha say that he speaks the truth, speaks at the right time, speaks what is real, what is meaningful, what is relevant?
Yes.
The Buddha said this:

original: “tayo me, seniya, satthāro santo saṁvijjamānā lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: tayaḥ me seniya satthāraḥ santaḥ savijjamānāḥ lokasmi
translated: ‘Seniya, there are three teachers found in the world.
What are the three?

original: Idha, seniya, ekacco satthā diṭṭheva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato paññāpeti, abhisamparāyañca attānaṁ saccato thetato paññāpeti.
analyzed: idha seniya ekaccaḥ satthā diṭṭhe iva dhamme attānam saccataḥ thetataḥ paññāpeti abhisamparāyañca attānam saccataḥ thetataḥ paññāpeti
translated: There is a teacher who claims to be omniscient and all-seeing, and to have all-embracing knowledge and vision. He says that he is absolute, that he teaches absolute things, and that he has realized absolute knowledge.

original: Idha pana, seniya, ekacco satthā diṭṭheva hi kho dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato paññāpeti, no ca kho abhisamparāyaṁ attānaṁ saccato thetato paññāpeti.🔽Idha pana, seniya, ekacco satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato na paññāpeti, abhisamparāyañca attānaṁ saccato thetato na paññāpeti.
analyzed: idha pana seniya ekaccaḥ satthā diṭṭhe iva hi kho dhamme attānam saccataḥ thetataḥ paññāpeti no ca kho abhisamparāyam attānam saccataḥ thetataḥ paññāpeti  idha pana seniya ekaccaḥ satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccataḥ thetatas na paññāpeti abhisamparāyañca attānam saccataḥ thetatas na paññāpeti
translated: “There is a teacher who proclaims a self that is material and limited in the present life, but not in future lives.🔽There is a teacher who proclaims a self that is neither material in the present life nor in future lives.

original: Tatra, seniya, yvāyaṁ satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato paññāpeti, abhisamparāyañca attānaṁ saccato thetato paññāpeti—
analyzed: tatra seniya yvā ayam satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccataḥ thetatas paññāpeti abhisamparāyañca attānam saccataḥ thetatas paññāpeti
translated: “Among these, the teacher who proclaims a self that is material and limited in the present life and also in future lives

analyzed: ayam vuccati seniya satthā sassata vādo
translated: is called a teacher who holds the doctrine of eternalism.

original: Tatra, seniya, yvāyaṁ satthā diṭṭheva hi kho dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato paññāpeti, no ca kho abhisamparāyaṁ attānaṁ saccato thetato paññāpeti—
analyzed: tatra seniya yvā ayam satthā diṭṭhe iva hi kho dhamme attānam saccatas thetatas paññāpeti no ca kho abhisamparāyam attānam saccatas thetatas paññāpeti
translated: “Among these, the teacher who proclaims a self that is material and limited in the present life, but not in future lives,

analyzed: ayam vuccati seniya satthā uccheda vādo
translated: is called a teacher who holds the doctrine of annihilationism.

original: Tatra, seniya, yvāyaṁ satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato na paññāpeti, abhisamparāyañca attānaṁ saccato thetato na paññāpeti—
analyzed: tatra seniya yvā ayam satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccatas thā itatas na paññāpeti abhisamparāyan ca attānam saccatas thā itatas na paññāpeti
translated: and who does not describe himself in the afterlife as being perfected in terms of self-identity and self-transcendence,
is called a teacher who is fully enlightened.

original: Ime kho, seniya, tayo satthāro santo saṁvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
analyzed: ime kho seniya tayo satthāraḥ santaḥ savijjamānāḥ lokasmin ti
translated: These are the three kinds of teachers found in the world.”
“Is there a discourse?”
“Yes.”
“Then you shouldn’t say,
‘A person is found who is not included in this enumeration.’
“Is there a discourse?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu bhagavā saccavādī kālavādī bhūtavādī tathavādī avitathavādī anaññathavādīti?
analyzed: nanu bhagavā sacca vādī kāla vādī bhūta vādī tatha vādī avitatha vādī anaññatha vādī iti
translated: “But didn’t the Buddha say that he is a speaker of the truth, a speaker of what is fact, a speaker of what is relevant, a teacher of the true Teaching?”
“Yes.”
“It was said by the Buddha:
‘A pot of ghee.’
“Yes.”

original: Atthi koci sappissa kumbhaṁ karotīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: atthi koci sappissa kumbham karoti iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is there anyone who makes a pot of ghee?”
“You shouldn’t say,
‘A person is found who is not included in this enumeration.’”
“Is a person found in a real and ultimate way?”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu bhagavā saccavādī kālavādī bhūtavādī tathavādī avitathavādī anaññathavādīti?
analyzed: nanu bhagavā sacca vādī kāla vādī bhūta vādī tatha vādī avitatha vādī anaññatha vādī iti
translated: “Isn’t the Buddha one who speaks of what is factual, true, and correct, of what is timely and beneficial?”
“Yes.”
“The Buddha said:

original: “telakumbho … madhukumbho … phāṇitakumbho … khīrakumbho … udakakumbho … pānīyathālakaṁ … pānīyakosakaṁ … pānīyasarāvakaṁ … niccabhattaṁ … dhuvayāgū”ti?
analyzed: tela kumbho madhu kumbho phāṇita kumbho khīra kumbho udaka kumbho pānīya thālakam pānīya kosakam pānīya sarāvakam niccabhattam
translated: a clay pot, a honey pot, a molasses pot, a milk pot, a water pot, a water dipper, a water jug, a water pot, a regular meal, and regular gruel.”
“Yes.”

original: Atthi kāci yāgu niccā dhuvā sassatā avipariṇāmadhammāti?
analyzed: atthi kāci yāgu niccā dhuvā sassatā a vipariṇāma dhammā ti
translated: “Is there any gruel that is permanent, everlasting, eternal, not subject to change?”
“That is not so by reason of the four noble truths.”
…pe…
“Well then, you shouldn’t say
that a person is found in a real and ultimate way.”
(Abbreviated.)
The eight sections of the “Questions”
and the “Consecutive Repetitions”,
The mind, the fifth, and the good,
The “Supernormal Powers” and the “Removal”, the eighth.
The discussion of the person is finished.
